pull.title: doc: clarify full Xcode download is not needed
pull.body: Some people keep thinking that you need to download the full 4GB of Xcode before running `xcode-select`. However `xcode-select` is already present on any freshly installed macOS.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
Not sure if this is needed? Anyone to copy-paste the command shouldn't run into issues and if you do random other stuff, you are on your own anyway?

verification.payload:
tree 71925366dc28919c5bcd3d011e1640ee8ecd530c
parent 2026301405f83c925ca68db6a3cd5134ed619ca7
author Sjors Provoost <sjors@sprovoost.nl> 1686233205 +0200
committer Sjors Provoost <sjors@sprovoost.nl> 1686233205 +0200

doc: clarify full Xcode download is not needed

events.message: doc: clarify full Xcode download is not needed

events.body:
Some background, it should indeed not be necessary to install Xcode: https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/install-xcode-command-line-tools/

I improved the prose a bit.

> Some background, it should indeed not be necessary to install Xcode:

It hasn't been required for at least 7 years, that's why we removed the instructions to install in: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/2692e1b10bd7a0be644ed8a69c54152bc741e855.

> Not sure if this is needed? Anyone to copy-paste the command shouldn't run into issues and if you do random other stuff, you are on your own anyway?

Agree with the above. Not sure where the confusion is coming from, and, [as mentioned](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27835#issuecomment-1589083587), this hasn't be required for at least 7 years, if not longer than that. Anyone who is following this guide, and just copy-pasting commands, shouldn't be accidently going to the macOS App Store and downloading the ~8GB Xcode app bundle.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -17,6 +17,7 @@ macOS comes with a built-in Terminal located in:
 
 The Xcode Command Line Tools are a collection of build tools for macOS.
 These tools must be installed in order to build Bitcoin Core from source.
+You do not need to install all of Xcode.
comments.body: Seems weird to say "you don't need to install" and the next line "To install, run...". If we want to advertise something, I prefer something like: "Recent MacOS versions may contain Xcode by default"

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -17,6 +17,7 @@ macOS comes with a built-in Terminal located in:
 
 The Xcode Command Line Tools are a collection of build tools for macOS.
 These tools must be installed in order to build Bitcoin Core from source.
+You do not need to install all of Xcode.
comments.body: macOS does not ship with all of Xcode, but they do ship with the `xcode-select` command.
